intro: Leptosyne heterocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-leafed dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its slender, hairy leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its fruit is a schizocarp consisting of two mericarps, each with a pappus for wind dispersal. Leptosyne heterocarpa is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a common weed in agricultural areas.
